result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:27 PM Defendant George D. Jackson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared by video for George D. Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested by Zoom and within time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.

9:46 AM Defendant George D. Jackson appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Shanna Sanders in court for George D. Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio in court for the State of Wisconsin. Conflict for Public Defenders Office.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.

03:15 PM Defendant George D. Jackson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kevin M Smith appeared by video for George D. Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, address updated, date of birth verified, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Cash bond set of $10,000.00   with conditions, No contact directly or indirectly with victims E.B. or A.M., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint with GPS monitoring. Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Curfew 6pm-6am unless at work or traveling to and from work. Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No non residents in home during pendency of action except emergency responders if needed. No possession of any weapon or firearms. Preliminary Hearing October 24, 2022 at 9:45 am.
